name: A "Twelfth Night" Of Quotes Quiz | Shakespeare | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"Confine? I'll confine myself no finer than I am. These 
clothes are good enough to drink in, and so be these boots 
too. An they be not, let them hang themselves in their own 
straps." 

Who said this to Olivia's maid, Maria?
questions.explanation:
Toby.

	Maria saw Sir Toby Belch, Olivia's uncle, come home earlier than he usually does, and she chastised him for coming home so late on the other evenings. She then mentioned that Olivia didn't like the man her uncle brought home for her to marry. Toby told Maria that Sir Andrew was the bravest, the wealthiest, and the smartest man in Illyria.

questions.text:
Who said, "If you will not murder me for my love, let me be your 
servant."
questions.explanation:
Antonio.

	A man named Antonio found Viola's twin brother, Sebastian, after a shipwreck. Antonio nursed Sebastian back to health and was expressing his interest in staying with his friend Sebastian even though Sebastian wanted to leave. Sebastian had no idea that his sister had survived the shipwreck.

questions.text:
"Following the one I love more than my eyes or my life. More than I will ever love a wife. That's the truth. The angels in heaven are my witnesses, and can see how pure my love is."

Who said this to Olivia?
questions.explanation:
Viola.

	Viola, who had been dressed as a man for three months, had fallen in love with Orsino and she was telling Olivia how much she loved him. Unfortunately, Olivia had fallen in love with Viola, not realizing she was a woman, and mistakenly married Viola's twin brother Sebastian.

questions.text: Who said, "He that is well hanged in this world needs to fear no colors"?
questions.explanation:
Feste.

	Maria was chastising Feste, the fool, when he returned from wherever he went, because he was gone for so long. She said that Olivia would have him killed. Feste replied that he wouldn't mind being killed because then he wouldn't have to worry about anything. Maria told him he got that attitude from being around the soldiers, but he would never get to fight with them.

questions.text:
"I have unclasped 
To thee the book even of my secret soul. 
Therefore, good youth, address thy gait unto her; 
Be not denied access, stand at her doors, 
And tell them there thy fixed foot shall grow 
Till thou have audience."

To whom did Orsino give this order?
questions.explanation:
Viola.

	Valentine and Viola (dressed as a man) were talking about how well Orsino liked Viola when Orsino came in and ordered Viola to go see Olivia and not leave until he got to see her. What Orsino didn't know was that Viola was in love with him.

questions.text:
"Thou canst not choose but know who I am. If thou 
entertainest my love, let it appear in thy smiling. Thy 
smiles become thee well. Therefore in my presence 
still smile, dear my sweet, I prithee."

This quote comes from a letter that Malvolio found when he was taking a walk. Who wrote the love letter to him?
questions.explanation:
Maria.

	Maria, Sir Toby, and Sir Andrew were playing a trick on Malvolio and making him believe that Olivia had written him a love letter when in fact it was Maria who wrote the letter. As Malvolio continued to read the letter, it said that he should smile at Olivia to let her know he returned the same feelings of love. Unbeknownst to Malvolio, Sir Toby and Sir Andrew were watching him read the letter.

questions.text: Who wrote the note that said, "Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and some have greatness thrust upon them"?
questions.explanation:
Maria.

	Maria wrote a letter to Malviolo and made him believe that Olivia had written the letter. After he read the letter addressed to him, Malvolio was prideful because he thought he would be well-respected and admired by everyone if he became Olivia's husband.

questions.text:
"What is love? 'Tis not hereafter.  
Present mirth hath present laughter.  
What's to come is still unsure.  
In delay there lies no plenty.  
Then come kiss me, sweet and twenty.  
Youth's a stuff will not endure."

Who sang this song to Sir Andrew and Sir Toby?
questions.explanation:
Feste.

	Sir Andrew and Sir Toby wanted Feste to sing a song because they liked his voice. Sir Toby said he would give money to have a voice as beautiful as Feste's. After Feste finished his song, Sir Toby and Sir Andrew wanted to sing a song called "The Knave" where the lyrics call for the singers to call each other knaves. Fabio was also there.

questions.text:
"Oh, it came o'er my ear like the sweet sound, 
That breathes upon a bank of violets, 
Stealing and giving odor." 

Who was in the room when Orsino said this?
questions.explanation:
Curio.

	Olivia's brother died, and after his death she swore that she wouldn't date anyone in honor of him. Orsino was depressed over his love for Olivia and was telling Curio that the music playing was causing him to fall deeper in love with her.

questions.text:
"'Tis beauty truly blent, whose red and white 
Nature's own sweet and cunning hand laid on. 
Lady, you are the cruel'st she alive 
If you will lead these graces to the grave 
And leave the world no copy." 

Who made this quote to Olivia?
questions.explanation:
Viola.

	Viola, dressed a man, came to tell Olivia how much Orsino loved her. She commented on how beautiful Olivia was and that she shouldn't hide her beauty from anyone or allow herself to not have children who would have her beautiful looks.
